primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God (in Christ) confronts the finality of death and human refusal of communion to restore life and fellowship.

tekstueel_bewijs: He summons Lazarus from the grave.
Jesus makes a request — or was it a command?
God made us — with the high honor of choice.

object.identificatie: The Glory of God / Life / Communion
tekstueel_bewijs: thou shouldest see the glory of God
someone with whom he would have communion
the principle teaching of the New Testament is that of a God whose ways are like Jesus'

helper.identificatie: Grace / The Holy Spirit (implied in benediction)
tekstueel_bewijs: It takes nothing short of grace to get us... in sync
the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ
cuts against the grain of what we are all about
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but 'finality' (death) and an ontological 'grain' that resists God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of believing in order to see.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human 'believing' is presented as the condition for 'seeing', but this is nested within God's primary action of overcoming death.

voorbeelden_god_subject: He summons Lazarus from the grave.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we will discover, we will be aware
we decide against the God who made us

voorbeelden: we must never believe that there are circumstances... beyond authority
God wanted someone with whom he would have communion
we will discover, we will be aware
authority and ability of the eternal God
it takes nothing short of grace to get us in sync

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) of God vs the 'Incompetence' of man. Grace is the endowment of power to a subject who 'cuts against the grain'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Finality) to ~S1 (Stench) to ~S2 (Believing) and finally S1 (Glory).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ's 'imperious word' which breaks the finality of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The preacher emphasizes 'Kaput! Finis!' to ensure the miracle is not trivialized.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. While it calls for belief, it identifies the human condition as 'against the grain' and 'helpless,' requiring God's initiative and power.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: if we will look squarely at ourselves... we will discover

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the Subject of the crux
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He summons Lazarus from the grave.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Lazarus is not a model to follow, but a recipient of a miracle. Martha is a representative of human limitation, not a moral hero.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God is the one who acts upon the dead.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe at God's capability.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation is God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon moves logically from human incapacity to divine capacity.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'If thou wouldest believe' (Human Subject) and 'He summons' (Divine Subject).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: authority and ability of the eternal God... conquerors

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Grace is described as the force that 'gets us in sync'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; it is a 'grain' that must be cut across.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's 'Pouvoir' overcoming the 'Opponent' of Death. The hearer is correctly positioned as the Receiver.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Devoir (must believe) in the conclusion.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Ensure 'believing' is seen as a gift (Pouvoir) rather than a work.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Frame 'believing' as the Spirit opening the eyes rather than a human venture.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God raises Lazarus) correctly precedes Ethics (We venture forth).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that takes the 'Heavy Opponent' of death seriously to magnify the 'Pouvoir' of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'grain' metaphor; Greimas shows the 'grain' is an Actantial Opponent.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek; Greimas explains why the story feels 'final' before the miracle.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the Subject-switch from Martha's helplessness to Jesus' command.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Helper-God' trap by making God the 'Subject' of the resurrection.
